item.title: Anna add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "And the air was full of Thoughts and Things to Say. But at times like these, only the Small Things are ever said. Big Things lurk unsaid inside." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Anna add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "The only way to cope with something deadly serious is to try to treat it a little lightly." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Anna add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You mean you're comparing our lives to a sonnet? A strict form, but freedom within it? Yes. Mrs. Whatsit said. You're given the form, but you have to write the sonnet yourself. What you say is completely up to you." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Anna add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Anna add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Each person who ever was or is or will be has a song. It isn't a song that anybody else wrote. It has its own melody, it has its own words. Very few people get to sing their song. Most of us fear that we cannot do it justice with our voices, or that our words are too foolish or too honest, or too odd. So people live their song instead." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Anna add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Stories may well be lies, but they are good lies that say true things, and which can sometimes pay the rent." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Anna add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Remember: that giants sleep too soundly; that witches are often betrayed by their appetites; dragons have one soft spot, somewhere, always; hearts can be well-hidden, and you can betray them with your tongue. (from "Instructions")" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Anna add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "May your coming year be filled with magic and dreams and good madness. I hope you read some fine books and kiss someone who thinks you're wonderful, and don't forget to make some art -- write or draw or build or sing or live as only you can. And I hope, somewhere in the next year, you surprise yourself." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Anna add a quote by Gail Carriger
item.description:
"I suspect it may be like the difference between a drinker and an alcoholic; the one merely reads books, the other needs books to make it through the day."
(Interview with <i>The Booklovers</i> blog, September 2010)" -- Gail Carriger

item.title: Anna add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "What greater thing is there for two human souls, than to feel that they are joined for life--to strengthen each other in all labor, to rest on each other in all sorrow, to minister to each other in all pain, to be one with each other in silent unspeakable memories at the moment of the last parting?" -- George Eliot

item.title: Anna add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "I had no one to help me, but the T. S. Eliot helped me. So when people say that poetry is a luxury, or an option, or for the educated middle classes, or that it shouldn’t be read at school because it is irrelevant, or any of the strange stupid things that are said about poetry and its place in our lives, I suspect that the people doing the saying have had things pretty easy. A tough life needs a tough language – and that is what poetry is. That is what literature offers – a language powerful enough to say how it is. It isn’t a hiding place. It is a finding place." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Anna add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Yes, the stories are dangerous, she was right. A book is a magic carpet that flies you off elsewhere. A book is a door. You open it. You step through. Do you come back?" -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Anna add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Six books… my mother didn’t want books falling into my hands. It never occurred to her that I fell into the books – that I put myself inside them for safe keeping." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Anna add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Breathe properly. Stay curious. And eat your beets." -- Tom Robbins
